marg LOCAL marg

NAME

mjo_arg_value — get an option's arguments

SYNOPSIS

#include <marg.h>

const mjo_vector_t
mjo_arg_value(size_t *const o_slots, const mjo_arg_t i_arg, unsigned char const *i_attribute);

DESCRIPTION

Lookup an option's arguments.

Following is a description of the arguments.

o_slots
pointer to ‘size_t’ that shall be set to the number of elements in the returned vector
i_arg
pointer to a ‘mjo_arg_t’ where the option will be searched for
i_attribute
option to lookup

If o_slots is nil, it shall not be set.

If i_arg is nil or i_attribute is nil or empty, *o_slots shall be set to 0 and the routine shall return 0.

RETURN VALUES

A pointer to a vector containing the arguments of i_attribute or nil if the attribute was not found.

NOTES

o_slots is for convienance. It shall be the same value returned by a call to mjo_vector_count().

November 25, 2021 OpenBSD 7.0
